intro: Lortetia vespertilio, commonly known as the evening larkspur, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. The plant has slender, upright stems and trifoliate leaves that are palmately arranged. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Lortetia vespertilio is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a hardy and resilient species.
